de.me.pooling

Interface SimpleExecutorService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Executor, ExecutorService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleThreadPoolExecutor

    public interface SimpleExecutorService
extends ExecutorService
    Extension of ExecutorService using blocked command queuing.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean execute(long timeout, TimeUnit unit, Runnable command)
      Executes the given command immediately or waits the given timeout until it was added to the command queue.
      void execute(Runnable command)
      Executes the given command immediately or waits until it was added to the command queue.
      boolean executeImmediately(Runnable command)
      Executes the given command immediately or adds it to the command queue immediately.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService

        awaitTermination, invokeAll, invokeAll, invokeAny, invokeAny, isShutdown, isTerminated, shutdown, shutdownNow, submit, submit, submit

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(Runnable command)
             throws ExecutionAwaitInterruptedException
        Executes the given command immediately or waits until it was added to the command queue.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Executor
        Parameters:
        command - the command to execute
        Throws:
        ExecutionAwaitInterruptedException - if calling thread was interrupted while waiting, thread will be re-interrupted (for compatibility to ExecutorService)
        IllegalStateException - if executor is already in shutdown or terminated

      • executeImmediately

        boolean executeImmediately(Runnable command)
        Executes the given command immediately or adds it to the command queue immediately.

        This is the same as execute(0L, TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS, command).
        Parameters:
        command - the command to execute
        Returns:
        true, if task was executed or added to the command queue, false if command queue was full
        Throws:
        ExecutionAwaitInterruptedException - if calling thread was interrupted (which should not happen)
        IllegalStateException - if executor is already in shutdown or terminated
        See Also:
        execute(long, TimeUnit, Runnable)

      • execute

        boolean execute(long timeout,
              TimeUnit unit,
              Runnable command)
                throws InterruptedException
        Executes the given command immediately or waits the given timeout until it was added to the command queue.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout to wait for enqueuing the command, negative value to block until it is enqueued
        unit - the timeout unit
        command - the command to execute
        Returns:
        true, if task was executed or added to the command queue, false if timeout occurred before
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if calling thread was interrupted
        IllegalStateException - if executor is already in shutdown or terminated
